Case reference: 2014001606.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1986, Sarah Pelletier was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. Witnesses saw her jump off the Jacques-Cartier Bridge into the Saint-Lawrence River at approximately 9:00 p.m.. Sarah hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2018063450.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2003, at approximately 8:30am, William King was seen for the last time when he left his seniors residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014042438.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2014, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Delaram Hashemi was seen for the last time leaving her home in Toronto, Ontario. Delaram had told her mother that she would be attending a party and would return home at 10:00 p.m., but she never returned.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2010002599.CaseDesc: On the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010, Curtis Barry left his residence on Britannia Avenue in Bradford, to walk his two dogs. He was reported missing when his wife returned home in the late afternoon and discovered he was not home. The dogs were located later the same day wandering the streets approximately 1 km from his residence. Mr. Barry has not been seen since and the dog leash has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, a ship and names Lauren, John and Cliff on boat
Torso (Back), 3 roses with names of Michelle, Kietan and Kayla

Case reference: 2021054828.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2021, at approximately 6:30 p.m., Berhanei Peynado was seen for the last time in the area of Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Berhanei was despondent.

Coat: Black, WINTER, Winter coat with fur collar
Hat: Black, Gold, BASEBALL, Baseball hat with gold maple leaf
Shoes: Black, White, RUNNING, Brand: Air Jordan
Tattoo: Chest, Wolf, arc angel with sword

Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Backpack: Light Blue, Black, Has black handles

Case reference: 2012020093.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2003, Garry Guenther, 58 years old, left his residence in the Hepburn district, SK. He was driving his white 1993 Ford F-150 truck with SK licence GGG. Mr. Guenther was reported to have been seen in Hoey, SK on the 23rd/ 24th of April, 2003, however, neither he nor his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Cotton, Grey, sweat shirt with an image of a fish on the front
Deformity: Right Leg, bow-legged, walks with noticeable limp

Case reference: 2022011021.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2022, Nicholas Adamson was seen for the last time walking away from an establishment in the area of Sullivan Avenue and Front Street South in Thorold, Ontario.

Shirt: White, BUTTON UP, Short sleeve button up
Tattoo: Left Chest, Head of a wolf

Case reference: 2014005677.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2011, John Fadden was last seen in the University Endowment Lands, British Columbia.  He also suffered from dementia.

Case reference: 2014001627.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1990, Robert Henson was seen for the last time riding his horse along the river in the Hummingbird Falls and Creek area in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta. While riding his horse, Robert was swept down the river.

Case reference: 2014005103.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Mathieu Duguay was seen for the last time while shouting for help in Rivière-des-Prairies in Montreal, Quebec. Some of Mathieu’s personal belongings were found on the banks of the river, not far from where witnesses saw the young man disappear into the river currents. Extensive searches of the area were conducted, but he was never found.

Hat: White, Baseball cap, possibly with Montreal Expos baseball team logo

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2012020095.CaseDesc: On February 21, 2006, between 8:00 and 8:30 am Draper Jim was dropped off on the road by the Health Center on the Saulteaux First Nation (North of Cochin, Saskatchewan). Draper was attempting to return home to the Witchekan First Nation and has not been seen since.

Scar: Lower Lip, Left side of lower lip
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Ying Yang Symbol

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2014002340.CaseDesc:
Margaret Schochenmaier was last seen on November 30, 1985, sometime after 3:00pm.  On that day Margaret was in the process of moving from her son's residence; but she never finished the move.
Margaret has previously gone missing in the past, usually for a few days to one month.

Scar: Forehead, Small scar on the left side

Case reference: 2014002183.CaseDesc: On July 1st, 1979, John Wong was seen for the last time leaving the area of the Grace Gospel Church in Niagara Falls, Ontario. His vehicle was located on Portage Road in close proximity to the Niagara River. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006017099.CaseDesc: Joan Dorothy Lawrence last resided on North Lancelot Road, Huntsville.

Case reference: 2022037338.CaseDesc: At the end of August 2016, Irfanul Hoque was seen for the last time as he left his family’s residence in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2013000132.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2008 Trevor Warkentin left the Pyschiatric Ward at the MSA Hospital in Abbotsford BC. A hospital staff worker believes seeing Trevor get into a red pick up truck, but no license plate was obtained.

Teeth: Good, Large gap between front teeth

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2014022293.CaseDesc: In February 1981, Emery LABOUCANE left his residence and went to work. While at work, he called his wife and stated he was on his way home. He never returned. His vehicle was later located at the Edmonton International Airport. LABOUCANE's credit cards were used in California over the course of the following month and then the usage ceased. No further activity was ever recorded on the credit cards.

Case reference: 2012020646.CaseDesc: Antonie Medzech was last seen outside the Midtown Plaza in downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 8:00 a.m. on December 13, 2002. Mrs. Medzech had been dropped off at that location to go shopping.

Jewelry: Leather, Watch, silver face, black strap

Case reference: 2014003872.CaseDesc: Diane Bélanger was last seen on August 8, 1982, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015059337.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2015, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Van Huong was last seen on vacation in Vietnam. The next morning, Van’s family noticed he had left the hotel room and had not returned.

Case reference: 2007004899.CaseDesc: James Gordon MacDonald was last seen by his father on October 23, 1980 in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Sault Ste Marie Police Service was conducted but to this date Mr. MacDonald has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020014.CaseDesc: Sharon Gayle Dawson was seen for the last time on Christmas day in 2010, when she left her home in Qualicum Beach on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. There is an unconfirmed report that she was seen on December 28, 2010 at the World Parrot Refuge near Coombs, B.C.

Case reference: 2021030112.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2021, Jeanette Marcotte was reported missing in Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette was last seen in Saskatchewan in 1981 or 1982, where she stated that she was headed to Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005585.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Amanda McLeod was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001761.CaseDesc: Henrietta Mille is originally from Nain, Newfoundland and had been living in St. John’s, Newfoundland for quite some time before her disappearance. Henrietta was known to frequent the clubs in the St. John’s downtown area. Her keys, purse and other belongings were found at the Key Club.

Case reference: 2006004499.CaseDesc: James Pearce was last seen in the Grafton area on October 5, 1999. On October 8, 1999, his 1949 pink Dodge pick-up truck was located at the Cobourg train station parking lot.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Brush Cut, Recent #2 cut at time of disappearance
Scar: Torso (Back), Numerous scars from an accident
Head, A 1 inch scar under hair on left side
Left Leg, Scar from a fracture
Tattoo: Right Hand, Banner with the name Laurie
Left Arm, Skeleton with top hat

Case reference: 2016013490.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2016, Ravishankar Vallepuram was seen for the last time at his residence in Scarborough, Ontario. Ravishankar has never gone missing in the past, nor has he spent the night away from his residence.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2006010199.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Chorney was last seen leaving the Keys Lake Campground near Grassy Narrows, Ontario to go for a boat ride.  He has never returned and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2021052226.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2016, at approximately 1:45 p.m., Daniel Leslie was last seen at Terrapin Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 2014005093.CaseDesc: Hooshang Imanpoorsaid was last seen on May 2, 2008. At that time, he was living in Brossard. He was reported missing by his family. Mr. Imanpoorsaid’s credit card was used at Dorval airport and the Netherlands in 2008. He is of Iranian descent.

Case reference: 2014005017.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1967, Margaret Mildred Batoche was reported missing from her family residence in Bonnyville, Alberta. Margaret always kept in contact with her family and friends, and her disappearance is considered suspicious.

Mark: Cheek, Wart on right cheek close to ear

Case reference: 2014001012.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2001, the skull of a man was discovered in a rural area near Mineral's Road in the town of Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Mr. Vrba. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2019017116.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2003, Anne-Marie Laforest was last seen by her family in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022000648.CaseDesc: Murray Marsden went missing from Calgary, Alberta, sometime between April 29, 2010, and December 28, 2021.

Deformity: Left Hand, Left hand fingers are flexed
Scar: Left Eye, Scar located in left eyebrow

Case reference: 2014003860.CaseDesc: Carl Charles Raun was reported missing on July 28, 1975. Mr. Raun had a fused spine, causing him to wear a brace, as well as a scar from back surgery. There is a possibility that Mr. Raun disappeared as a result of foul play, however this has not been confirmed.

Case reference: 2013000114.CaseDesc: Abigail Andrews, a single Metis woman, lived in a basement suite in Fort St. John. She worked at FSJ Fashions, and The Frontier Bar and Grill. She was pregnant but not yet showing. Abigail was last seen on the evening of April 7, 2010 walking from her home towards a friend's house.

Teeth: Good, Used a dental pallet retainer
Deformity: Right Index Finger, Previously broken and healed in a deformed position

Case reference: 2014006393.CaseDesc: In June 2002, Edward Decoyne was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2007002399.CaseDesc: Marilyn Neely was last seen by a friend on September 18, 1983, driving Southbound on Goodfellow Road, in the county of Peterborough. Her vehicle, a 1975 Dodge Dart, was later found on the Five Point Trail access road approximately 11 km west of Hwy #507. That same day a woman matching her description was seen walking west along the road from that location.

Purse: Green, White, vinyl with a white shoulder strap

Case reference: 2014006270.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Daniel Pierre was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was driving a rented 2014 black Jeep Grand Cherokee, and was accompanied by his reddish brown, with a white chest, male pit-bull. The vehicle was subsequently located on the corner of Deguire Boulevard and Ashton Street in the Ville Saint-Laurent neighbourhood in Montreal. Daniel is a diabetic and depends on medication that is not in his possession.

Case reference: 2014005703.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1964, Harold Jackman was seen for the last time at his farm in Shillington, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Harold wandered away from his farm.

Case reference: 2020017934.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Lebohang Nicol was seen for the last time in the area of 600 University Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Lebohang is also known to go by the first name of “Toby.” He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2013000065.CaseDesc: Pierrette Courcelles was last seen on November 22, 1991 in Montreal.

Tattoo: Right Arm, picture of a heart, a cross and an eagle with "ROBERT" (text)

Case reference: 2014002740.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 1997, Ferdinand Dauz was last seen in New Westminster British Columbia.  Mr. Dauz was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002295.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1979, James Caraley was last seen when he went mountain climbing on Mount Andromeda in Jasper, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021006608.CaseDesc: On July 4,2020, Anna Marquart was last seen by her husband and her sister as she walked away from her residence in Glenboro, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014001849.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1974, Murphy Williams was last seen working in a labour camp located between Fort St. John and Dawson Creek in British Columbia. It was reported that Mr. Williams was exhibiting signs of distress and it is believed that he may have attempted to walk from the labour camp to Fort St. John.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003366.CaseDesc: The morning of July 8, 1981,  the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP were notified that an aluminum boat with an outboard motor was going in circles just out from the new houses in Sheshatshiu, NL.  Police were advised that the boat was unoccupied and travelling quite fast in circles. The investigation determined that the boat had been once occupied by John Morris Groves of North West River, NL and it appears that he had fallen overboard.  The body of Mr. Groves has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2013000090.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1983, Nicola Michel Tola was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He was suppose to come home and make dinner but he was never seen again by his family. His car was located at the Pie IX shopping mall.

Case reference: 2014005229.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2009 at around 11:00 am, Ronald Hallam was seen for the last time on his property on Prosperity Line road in the municipality of Ashfield-Colborne-Wawanosh, Ontario.

Pants: Brown, Khaki, Light brown work pants

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1995, Gareth Austin and Dominic Park were seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2019050942.CaseDesc: On August 16, 2019, Aaron Wuttunee was seen for the last time in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. During the time of his disappearance, Aaron had mentioned to an acquaintance that he may hitchhike to Edmonton, Alberta. There is also a possibility that he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia, but it has not been confirmed. Aaron is known for leading a transient lifestyle, and suffered from a brain injury that causes short term memory loss and makes him prone to falling.

Case reference: 2013000074.CaseDesc: Pasquale Giannetti has been missing from Montreal since November 26, 1984. His vehicle was located at L'Ile Ste-Hélène and his clothes were found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2012020018.CaseDesc: Sahil Sharma has been missing from the Newton area of Surrey, B.C. since November 13, 2008.  On the day Sahil disappeared, he had attended to Kwantlen University in Surrey, B.C. to pay for his upcoming semester to study Information Technology.  Sahil did not have any known drug or alcohol addictions and no known mental health issues.  Sahil's disappearance is highly out of character and all avenues of investigation have not provided any information on his whereabouts.

Sweater: Grey, Red, Red stripes on the neck
Tattoo: Right Forearm, "RAM" written in Hindi symbols

Case reference: 2014004632.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 2005, Dean Phillips  was reported missing by his family in Campbell River, British Columbia. Dean was  last seen at a local school in Campbell River and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003811.CaseDesc: On December 28, 1988, Murray Copp was seen for the last time at the Salvation Army Community and Family Services Centre in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Scar: Nose, Between eyes and above nose

Case reference: 2022002122.CaseDesc: On January 3, 2022, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Karl Neff was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Port Colborne, Ontario. Karl has ties to the St. Catharines area in Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005589.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1971, Lillian Giroux was seen for the last time when she was left with relatives in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004558.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Rodolfo Morales was last heard from when he spoke to his friend over the telephone.

Case reference: 2014004349.CaseDesc: Candace Giebel was last seen on August 1, 2002. She may have left Vancouver with her boyfriend at that time; her whereabouts and destination are unknown. Her family has not heard from her since her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003567.CaseDesc: On November 24, 2001, Jocelyn Gadoury was seen for the last time when he left his home in Laval, Quebec to go to his garage in Saint-Eustache, Quebec. Jocelyn has not been seen or heard from since.

Sweater: White, T Shirt, With writing "PATRON DE ZAPET"

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2014025774.CaseDesc: In August 2014, Pawel Przybyla was reported missing by his family. He was last believed to be in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2018027693.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, at around 8:30 am, Diane Mae Bignell was last seen on Juniper Street in Thompson, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014005066.CaseDesc: James Douglas Turnball or Turnbull was last seen on the MV Princess of Vancouver vessel commuting from Nanaimo to Vancouver in the waters of the Howe Sound in 1966. Bowen Island RCMP are seeking any next of kin or close relations for the missing male.

Jewelry: Gold, Yellow, Black, black diamond ring
Gold, Yellow, Brown, Timex watch with leather strap

Case reference: 2014002504.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1982, friends reported Michael Roshko missing to police. At the time Michael had not been seen in over a week and friends had become concerned. Police located Michael's camp and found his personal belongings still there. Mr. Roshko has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014005145.CaseDesc: Sometime after July 30, 1939, Charles "Henry" Baxter went missing from the Hawarden District, SK. At the time of his disappearance, it was thought that Mr. Baxter went across the river to Tichfield to find work, or even joined the military and went overseas. However, Mr. Baxter was never seen again by his family, and these theories have never been substantiated.

Case reference: 2014005158.CaseDesc: Mr. Frederick Lagrelle was last seen on April 12, 1997 in the area of the Sunchild and O’Chiese First Nations in Alberta. It is possible Mr. Lagrelle was seen in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta days after. He was known to walk with a cane and wear a leg/knee brace. Mr. Lagrelle was described by family as having an intellectual disability as a result of a past accident.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2022059675.CaseDesc: On November 24, 2022, at approximately 10: 00 p.m, Rebecca Fudge-Schnarr was seen for the last time at her family’s residence in Iroquois Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004812.CaseDesc: Grant MOFFAT attended the Fas Gas outlet at the junction of HWY 5 and PTH 68. Here he purchased a fishing license. MOFFAT was at this location for about 20 minutes and did not seem to be in a hurry. On August 20, 2006 the vehicle belonging to MOFFAT was located on HWY 481 about 3 km west of Crane River. The vehicle had not been reported stolen. The whereabouts of MOFFAT remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004516.CaseDesc: On March 19 2004, Daniel James Murray was reported missing to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel slipped on ice and fell into the North Saskatchewan River in the area of Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2017072253.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Nadia Atwi was seen for the last time at her residence in north Edmonton, Alberta. Later that day, Nadia’s abandon vehicle was discovered in some bushes down the side of a hill entering Rundle Park.

Case reference: 2014002090.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2000, Stephane Levesque was seen for the last time at his home in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Stephane went to move his car from one side of the street to the other, and he never came back.

Coat: Black, Winter coat with Skidoo written in yellow

Case reference: 2014004061.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1984, Robert Dwyer was seen for the last time when he left his residence at the Keirstead Trailer Park, which is located on the west side of Saint John, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Grey, Bomber, dark grey corduroy front

Case reference: 2014004498.CaseDesc: Guillermina Coleman left her residence in the Cypress View Foundation between 8:00 p.m. on July 4, and 10:00 a.m. on July 5, 2004. Mrs. Coleman was despondent, and was released from the hospital only a few days before she was last seen. Mrs. Coleman was only able to walk for short distances.

Case reference: 2011005399.CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.

Backpack: Green, Duffle bag containing a bathing suit
Glasses: Large and round with tinted lenses
Pants: White, With blue, pink and red stripes

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2014004253.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2000, two boats were on the Churchill River headed to Granville Lake. One of the boats began taking on water and experiencing motor problems. Most of the occupants of the disabled boat boarded another boat. Mr. Linklater however stayed on the disabled boat attempting to start it. The missing boat was located the next day, however Mr. Linklater was not aboard. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2013000063.CaseDesc: Pierre-Paul Proulx was reported missing to the Service de police de la Ville de Montreal on August 21, 2002. He was last seen in Montreal on August 8, 2002 when he left his apartment located in the Plateau du Mont-Royal district with his vehicle after receiving a phone call.

Pierce: Ears, Gold loop in left ear

Case reference: 2014006304.CaseDesc: Richard Gaida left his hometown of Martensville, Saskatchewan for Kelowna, British Columbia at the end of September, 2012.  Richard was in the Kelowna area to work, however, Richard has not been seen or heard from since September, 2012 when he was last in contact with family and co-workers.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2018062782.CaseDesc: On April 12, 1993, at approximately 4:30pm, Helen Bialowas was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.
